clinical_study.brief_title: Postoperative Pain Management After Minimally Invasive Aortic Valve Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Ropivacaine Wound Infiltration for Postoperative Pain Management After Minimally Invasive Aortic Valve Surgery

brief_summary.textblock:
The study evaluates the efficacy of local anesthestic application through the catheter in the surgical wound for the postoperative pain relief after minimally invasive aortic valve surgery. The patients will be enrolled in the three different groups according to the protocol of the local anesthetic and saline administration:
1. group: continous infusion of the local anesthetic plus bolus on demand
2. group: bolus of local anesthetic on demand
3. group: continous infusion of saline plus bolus on demand For all patients metamizol every 12 hours plus bolous of piritramid on demand.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients undergoing minimally invasive aortic valve replacment surgery will be enroled in the study, after giving a signed informed consent.
The study evaluates the efficacy of local anesthestic application through the catheter in the surgical wound for the postoperative pain relief after minimally invasive aortic valve surgery.
Patients will then be randomised in three groups according to the protocol:
1. group: continous infusion of the local anesthetic plus bolus on demand
2. group: bolus of local anesthetic on demand
3. group: continous infusion of saline plus bolus on demand All patients will receive Metamizol every 12 hours plus bolus of piritramid on demand.
Analgesia effectivness will be checked hourly according to the visual analogue scale (VAS). According to protocol, bolus will be given every time the score of VAS scale is >3.
The catheter will be removed 48 hours after the protocols' start.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of daily cumulative postoperative dose of Piritramid between the three different protocols, using VAS scale to determine level of analgesia.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 48 hours after admission to the intensive care unit (ICU)

secondary_outcome.measure: Complications related to the catheter in the surgical wound

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 48 hours after admission to the ICU

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the effectivness between the two protocols of continous and bolus administration of local anesthetic, using VAS scale to determine level of analgesia.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 48 hours after admission to the ICU

intervention.description: Piritramid will be administered i.v., if the patients feel pain after receiving a bolus of Ropivacaine or saline through the catheter.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients after minimally invasive aortic valve surgery
- Patients agreement with the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age under 18 years
- Allergy to local anesthetic
